title: My new turntable plays vinyl records at the wrong speeds, what should I do about it? Records sound either too fast or too slow at 33 RPM and 45 RPM and neither sound normal. - Quora

response.answer_text: Take note of anything on a 33 RPM record’s label that you can identify. Start the record playing, with the stylus in the groove. Start a stopwatch and count the times that mark goes around in precisely three minutes (one person counting and a second manning the stopwatch might be easier). If your count is 100, then it’s running at the proper speed. If you get a count that’s much different, contact the seller. Or check the user manual for the ‘table; some are adjustable on purpose.
